p.s: The newspaperarticlenewspaper article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't from the The Telegraph was written by the author John Worne and published on the 27 January 2015 is about the fall of teenagers learning foreign languagelanguages in the last years in the UK.
In the following the newspaperarticlenewspaper article is going to be analyzed, in how far John Worne presents his view and how he makes use of communicative strategies as well as use of language.

The author starts of with saying that more and more people choose to not study foreign languages (cf. ll. 3-5) and that the number of UK students choosing to study foreign languages at university level has been in steady decline (l. 3-5).
With this sentence Worne wants to introduce the reader into the topic and wants to point out the problem.

Moreover he makes use of inclusive language as he writes our collective brains (l. 7) which has the effect that the reader feels more adressedaddressed and becomes clear of the problem that more people have to learn foreign languages or the reader himself too.

Then the author writes that there are more languages in the menu of primary schools (cf. ll. 8-9) which is a good point but then quotes, that the uptake of languages at CGSE and A-level has also stalled (cf.ll. 11-12) which shows that the schools have the same problem as the universities have and has the influence on the reader, that it is the fault of the schools too and not only the fault of the students by do notnot learning foreign languages enough.
After that the author points out that More than 10,000 fewer language A-level exams were taken last year than at the end of the 1990s (l. 13-14).
That shows the fall of interestsinterest in foreign languagelanguages by the students.
In this case Worne is able to show the reader the immense downfall of interestsinterest in foreign languages.

In addition to this he also makes use of a rhetorical device, which is the comparison and shows the immense gap between the end of the 1990s and today, in case of 10,000 fewer A-level exams (cf.ll. 14).
Moreover the author says that highly educated people say you do not have to worry (cf.ll. 18) because they think everybody can speak English very well, which is in fact not true.
To make this more clear the author makes use of exclusive language they don't and points out that there are many people who can notcannot speak English very well.

In addition to this he makes use of an example your iPhone will now translate road signs for you (l. 20) which also makes clear that many people make use of technological devices and do not learn the foreign language anymore, which they will do in future too.

In addition to this he points out how important the foreign language in a globalized world is as he makes use of aan Alltierationalliteration languages are essential for our trade, prosperity, culture exports, diplomacy and national security (l. 26-27).
That has the effect to reader that he gets the importance of the foreign language and maybe gets the message of the author, that you as a reader have to learn the foreign language.
Besides Worne points out that some universities study in addition to the main subject a language (cf.ll. 38).
He gives a kind of solution to the reader.
In the end he quotes that more young people have to develop their englishEnglish skills by also getting help by their parents (cf.ll. 45-51).
In this sentence he makes use of ana personification the UK needs which tells the problem that in the UK are too many young people who can't speak a foreign language.

Moreover Worne uses a metaphor childrens bows (l. 50) to point out that the children and teenagers can notcannot learn a foreign language by themselfthemselves, they need the support and help by their parents.
He also includes himself by saysaying I'm one (l. 46), so the text is more authentic.
Worne does write in a neutral style and has a good choice of words for example cultural exports (l. 26) or diplomacy (l. 26) which makes the newspaperarticlenewspaper article more reliable.
Besides he makes use of hypotactic and paratactic sentences.
All in all one can say that Worne has a clear structure and makes use of rhetorical devices to make his newspaperarticlenewspaper article more reliable.
Moreover he does have the clear opinion that yound people have to learn foreign languages and gives in the end a solution.
